name: Ehrhart's volume conjecture
summary:
In the geometry of numbers, Ehrhart's volume conjecture gives an upper bound on the volume of a convex body containing only one lattice point in its interior.  It is a kind of converse to Minkowski's theorem, which guarantees that a centrally symmetric convex body 
  
    
      
        K
      
    
    {\displaystyle K}
  
 must contain a lattice point as soon as its volume exceeds 
  
    
      
        
          2
          
            n
